Package reminder

Class QuartzReminder

java.lang.Object
reminder.QuartzReminder
All Implemented Interfaces:
Reminder
public class QuartzReminder extends Object implements Reminder
QuartzReminder is an implementation of Reminder interface

Nguyen Tuan Ngoc

    • buildJobDetail

      private org.quartz.JobDetail buildJobDetail(int eventID)

      Implemented function on the basis of the job builder and the job data map between the key and assign the value for the job. JobDataMap

      Build the job by mapping the key value from the job to the implemented function.

      buildJobDetail is used to instantiate JobDetails.

      Use this helper method buildJobDetail to implement JobDetail return Job, and which is implemented by JobBuilder.

      Returns:
      JobDetail JobDetail.
      See Also:

      • Return the description given to the JobDetail instance by its creator (if any).

    • buildJobTrigger

      Returns:
      Trigger Trigger.

    • defineOwnCronDefinition

      private static com.cronutils.model.definition.CronDefinition defineOwnCronDefinition()

      Sample builder make the builder of the cronCron much more easier

      Client code can then use the DSL to write code such as this:CronDefinition

            CronDefinition cronDefinition = defineOwnCronDefinition();
      Returns:
      cronDefinition sample by simply calling CronDefinition

    • convertZonedDateTime

      public ZonedDateTime convertZonedDateTime(ZonedDateTime sourceDate, String destZone)

      This help you to reduce the boilerplate code when calling each time you want to change the time zone

      This is demonstration code for the api client 

           ZoneDateTime dateAndTimeInSydney = convertZonedDateTime("London/UK","Australia/Sydney");
      Parameters:
      sourceDate -
      destZone -
      Returns:
      ZonedDateTime

    • formatInstant

      public static String formatInstant(Instant instant, String timeZone, String pattern)
      Formats a datetime stamp from an instant using a formatting pattern.

      Note: a formatting pattern containing 'a' (for the period; AM/PM) is treated differently at noon/midday. Using that pattern with a datetime whose time falls on "12:00 PM" will cause it to be formatted as "12:00 NOON".

      Parameters:
      instant - the instant to be formatted
      timeZone - the time zone to compute local datetime
      pattern - formatting pattern, see Oracle docs for DateTimeFormatter for pattern table
      Returns:
      the formatted datetime stamp string

    • CronBuilder

      private com.cronutils.model.Cron CronBuilder(Instant starttime) throws Exception

      Return type Cron.

      Since this must require the Instant instance as the passing argument

      This function is made followed the basic constructor builder that Cron.

      Parameters:
      starttime -
      Returns:
      cron builder sample with the format is UTC is the time zone and also include some basic features that the time of the calendar should have.
      Throws:
      Exception
